decks.notes: The deck revolves around utilizing artifacts to control the game and disrupt opponents, while also generating value through recursion and card advantage. Daretti, Scrap Savant serves as the commander, allowing for artifact reanimation and manipulation. Cards like Trash for Treasure and Goblin Welder are used to swap artifacts in and out of the graveyard, while cards like Mycosynth Lattice and Painter's Servant can create powerful combos. The deck also includes a variety of removal spells, board wipes, and prison effects to keep opponents in check. Overall, the key concept of the deck is to establish board control through artifacts and grind out incremental advantages until victory is achieved.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Partner commanders Thrasios and Tymna to create a synergistic aggro strategy in a Duel Commander format. The deck includes a wide range of powerful creatures and spells to apply pressure on the opponent, while also providing utility and card advantage through various means such as tutoring, removal, and recursion. With a diverse selection of versatile creatures like Devoted Druid, Spell Queller, and Noble Hierarch, along with powerful spells like Swords to Plowshares and Demonic Tutor, the deck aims to quickly establish a strong board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By combining aggressive creatures with efficient disruption and card advantage, the deck seeks to overwhelm opponents and secure victory in the commander format.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. Kess, Dissident Mage allows you to recast instants and sorceries from your graveyard, which synergizes well with the spells in your deck. The deck includes a variety of counterspells such as Cryptic Command, Force of Will, and Mana Leak to disrupt your opponent's game plan. Removal spells like Terminate, Fatal Push, and Dismember help you deal with threats on the board. Card advantage is provided through cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, Fact or Fiction, and Snapcaster Mage. By controlling the game with a mix of counterspells, removal, and card advantage, you aim to outvalue and outmaneuver your opponent.

The main idea of this deck is to utilize the powerful partners Thrasios and Tymna to assemble a wide array of creatures and tutor effects to create a resilient and versatile aggro strategy. By including cards like Aether Vial, Birthing Pod, Aluren, and various tutors, the deck aims to consistently put threats on the board and disrupt opponents' strategies. The inclusion of a wide variety of creatures with different abilities allows for flexibility in adapting to various board states and opponents. Additionally, the mana base is carefully crafted to support the four-color requirements of the deck while also providing access to powerful lands like Wasteland and Cavern of Souls.

This aggressive deck revolves around utilizing Grenzo, Havoc Raiser as the commander to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of goblin creatures, direct damage spells, and powerful artifacts. The deck focuses on maintaining a fast-paced tempo by deploying a wide variety of goblin creatures with abilities that synergize well together, such as Goblin Piledriver and Krenko, Mob Boss. The inclusion of cards like Goblin King and Purphoros, God of the Forge further enhances the goblin tribal theme and provides additional win conditions. By combining creature aggression with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Flame Slash, the deck aims to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total and secure victory through relentless pressure.

The deck centers around a fast-paced, aggressive strategy utilizing Kari Zev, Skyship Raider as the commander. The main focus is to quickly deal damage to the opponent through a combination of direct damage spells and aggressive creatures. Cards like Lightning Bolt, Chain Lightning, and Flame Javelin provide direct damage to the opponent, while creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear apply pressure early on. Additionally, cards like Blood Moon and Magus of the Moon disrupt the opponent's mana base, giving the deck an edge. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly with its aggressive creatures and burn spells, ultimately leading to a fast victory.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays and efficient removal, utilizing the synergy between Tymna the Weaver and Kraum, Ludevic's Opus to maintain card advantage and pressure the opponent. The deck runs a mix of control elements such as counterspells and hand disruption, along with burn spells and efficient creatures to apply pressure on the opponent. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistent color access and to support the aggressive game plan. By combining card advantage, removal, and aggressive creatures, the deck aims to establish an early lead and maintain control of the game until victory is achieved.

This deck revolves around utilizing The Gitrog Monster's ability to draw cards whenever a land is put into the graveyard to assemble a powerful combo. By taking advantage of cards like Crucible of Worlds, Ramunap Excavator, and Life from the Loam to repeatedly play and sacrifice lands, the deck aims to generate a massive amount of card advantage and mana. This allows for explosive plays such as casting Emrakul, the Promised End or Primeval Titan early in the game. The deck also includes various control elements like Duress and Abrupt Decay to disrupt opponents' strategies while ramping and setting up its own win condition. The key strategy is to efficiently play lands, draw cards, and establish a dominant position on the board to overwhelm opponents.
